§ 154.101 EXCEPTIONS.
   The minimum lot area and width requirements established in §
154.100 may be modified as follows.
   (A)   Where a lot of record at the time of the effective date of this Zoning
Code has less area or width than herein required in the district in which it is
located, and the owner of such lot does not own any other parcel or tract
adjacent thereto, such lot may never the less be used for a one-family dwelling
or for any non-dwelling use permitted in the district in which it is located.
   (B)   Existing buildings that are in violation of lot area requirements may
be remodeled or repaired, but may not be reconstructed or structurally altered
unless made to conform to this Zoning Code.
   (C)   Lot area per family requirements shall not apply to dormitories,
fraternities, sororities, nursing homes, or other similar group quarters where
no cooking facilities are provided in individual rooms or apartments.
   (D)   In the RU District, the minimum lot area per family may be reduced to
20,000 square feet and the lot width to 100 feet where public water service is
available but where there is no public sewer service, or to 15,000 square feet
and 80 feet, respectively, where both public water and public sewer services
are available.
(Prior Code, § 154.61) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
OFF-STREET PARKING AND LOADING REGULATIONS
§ 154.115 OFF-STREET PARKING REQUIREMENTS.
   Off-street parking spaces shall be provided as follows in all districts,
except the C-2 Central Business District:
   (A)   All non-residential buildings, except those specified herein: one
space for each 300 square feet of floor area;
   (B)   Auditoriums, theaters, and other places of public assembly: one
parking space for each five seats;
   (C)   A church or temple: one parking space for each four seats in the main
auditorium;
   (D)   A community center, library, museum, or similar public or semi-public
building: one parking space for each 300 square feet of floor area in the
building;
   (E)   A funeral home: ten parking spaces for each chapel, plus one for each
funeral home vehicle, plus one for each family residing on the premises;
   (F)   A hospital: two and three-tenths parking spaces for each bed;
   (G)   A hotel or motel: five parking spaces plus one space for each sleeping
room or suite;
   (H)   A manufacturing or industrial establishment, research or testing
laboratory, creamery, bottling plant, warehouse, or other similar
establishment: two parking spaces for every three employees on the maximum
shift, plus space to accommodate all trucks and other vehicles used in
connection therewith;
   (I)   A medical office building, buildings in which 20% or more of the gross
area is occupied by members of the healing profession: one parking space for
each 200 square feet of the gross area used for this purpose;
   (J)   Multiple dwellings: one and one-half spaces for each dwelling unit in
the RD and RA Districts, and one and two-tenths spaces for each dwelling unit
in all other districts;
   (K)   A private club or lodge: one parking space for each 400 square feet of
floor area;
   (L)   Rooming and boarding houses, sororities, and fraternities: one parking
space for each 200 square feet of floor area;
   (M)   A sanitarium or institutional home: one parking space for each three
beds;
   (N)   A school for high schools, colleges, and universities: ten spaces per
classroom; for elementary schools: two parking spaces per classroom; and
   (O)   Single-family and two-family dwellings: two spaces for each dwelling
unit.
(Prior Code, § 154.65) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.116 RULES FOR COMPUTING PARKING SPACES.
   In computing the number of required off-street parking spaces, the following
rules shall apply:
   (A)   Floor area shall mean the gross floor area of the specific use,
excluding any floor or portion thereof used for parking;
   (B)   Where fractional spaces result, the parking spaces required shall be
the nearest whole number;
   (C)   In the case of mixed uses, the parking spaces required shall equal the
sum of the requirements of the various uses computed separately; and
   (D)   Whenever a building or use constructed or established after the
effective date of this Zoning Code is changed or enlarged in floor area, number
of employees, number of dwelling units, seating capacity, or otherwise, parking
spaces shall be provided on the basis of the enlargements or change. Whenever a
building or use existing prior to the effective date of this Zoning Code is
reconstructed or is enlarged to the extent of 20% or more in floor area, such
building or use, in its entirety, shall then and thereafter comply with the
parking requirements set forth herein. Any enlargement or change in use of less
than 20% of the gross floor area shall be provided with parking based on the
enlargement or change.
(Prior Code, § 154.66) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.117 LOCATION OF REQUIRED PARKING SPACES.
   All parking spaces required herein shall be located as follows.
   (A)   The parking spaces required for residential buildings or uses shall be
located on the same lot with the building or use served. The parking paces
required for any other building or use may be located within 200 feet of the
building, and two or more owners of buildings may join together in providing
the required parking spaces. Where the required parking spaces are not located
on the same lot with the building or use served, the usage of the lot or tract
upon which such parking spaces are provided shall be restricted by an
instrument of record describing the premises for which such parking so long as
required by this Zoning Code.
   (B)   No parking space may be located in a front yard in any residential
district.
(Prior Code, § 154.67) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.118 MINIMUM IMPROVEMENT AND MAINTENANCE STANDARDS.
   Parking lots and garages shall conform with the following improvement
standards: All open parking areas provided in compliance with this Zoning Code
shall be surfaced with a durable, dust-proof surface consisting of concrete or
asphaltic concrete, with adequate base as approved by the designated
engineering personnel of the village. The parking areas shall be maintained in
a usable dust-proof condition and graded and drained to dispose of all surface
water. Whenever lighting is provided, it shall be so hooded or shielded as to
reflect the light away from abutting or neighboring property, including public
rights-of-way. One standard tree of at least three-inch diameter shall be
planted on the lot for each ten parking spaces. The location each parking space
and the direction of movement along the access driveways shall be indicated by
painting upon the surface of the lot. A structurally sound wall or other
abutment shall be installed and so placed around each side of the parking lot
to ensure that no part of an automobile either extends over or is capable of
accidentally rolling across the property line of the parking lot.
(Prior Code, § 154.68) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.119 OFF-STREET LOADING REQUIREMENTS.
   There shall be provided, at the time any building is erected or structurally
altered, off -street loading space in accordance with the following
requirements:
   (A)   Office buildings, apartments, apartment hotels, motels and hotels: one
space for each 5,000 to 50,000 square feet of gross floor area; two spaces for
each 50,000 to 200,000 square feet of gross floor area; and one additional
space for each 75,000 square feet of gross floor area above 200,000 square
feet;
   (B)    A retail or service establishment or wholesale commercial use: one
space for each 2,000 to 20,000 square feet of gross floor area; two spaces for
each 20,000 to 100,000 square feet of gross floor area; and one additional
space for each 75,000 square feet of gross floor area above 100,000 square
feet;
   (C)   A manufacturing or industrial use: one space for each 10,000 square
feet of floor area or fraction thereof in excess of 5,000 square feet; and
   (D)   In all cases where the off-street loading space is located in a manner
that a truck must back directly from a major street into a loading space, a
maneuvering space of not less than 50 feet shall be provided on the lot on
which the industrial use is located.
(Prior Code, § 154.69) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO ALL DISTRICTS
§ 154.130 CONFORMITY WITH PERMITTED USES.
   Buildings shall only be erected, converted, enlarged, reconstructed, or
structurally altered, and land shall only be used, for a purpose permitted in
the district in which the building or land is located.
(Prior Code, § 154.75) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.131 CONFORMITY WITH HEIGHT LIMITS.
   Buildings shall be erected, converted, enlarged, reconstructed, or
structurally altered only in conformity with the area regulations of the
district in which the building is located.
(Prior Code, § 154.76) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.132 CONFORMITY WITH AREA REGULATIONS.
   Buildings shall be erected, converted, enlarged, reconstructed, or
structurally altered only in conformity with the area regulations of the
district in which the building is located.
(Prior Code, § 154.77) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.133 MINIMUM DENSITY AND YARD REGULATIONS.
   The density and yard requirements of this Zoning Code are minimum
regulations for each and every building existing at the effective date of this
Zoning Code and for any building hereafter erected or structurally altered.
Land required for yards or other open spaces about an existing building or any
building hereafter erected or structurally altered shall not be considered a
yard or lot area for more than one building.
(Prior Code, § 154.78) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.134 ONE MAIN BUILDING PER LOT.
   Every building hereafter erected or structurally altered shall be located on
a lot and in no case shall there be more than one main building on a lot except
as otherwise provided in this Zoning Code.
(Prior Code, § 154.79) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.135 CONFORMITY WITH OFF-STREET PARKING AND LOADING REQUIREMENTS.
   Buildings shall only be erected or structurally altered to the extent
specifically provided herein in conformity with the off-street parking and
loading requirements of §§
154.115 through
154.119.
(Prior Code, § 154.80) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.136 CONFORMITY BY ALL FORMS OF PROPERTY OWNERSHIP.
   Cooperatives, condominiums, and all other forms of property ownership do not
affect the provisions of this Zoning Code, and all requirements shall be
observed as though the property were under single ownership.
(Prior Code, § 154.81) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.137 LOCATION OF MOBILE HOMES AND TRAVEL TRAILERS.
   All inhabited mobile homes and travel trailers shall be located in a mobile
home park or travel trailer court that has received a conditional use permit as
required by §
154.056. No mobile home or travel trailer outside an approved mobile home park
or travel trailer court shall be connected to utilities except those mobile
homes or travel trailers being offered for sale and not inhabited.
(Prior Code, § 154.82) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
§ 154.999 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
Zoning Code or builds or alters any building in violation of any detailed
statement or plan submitted and approved hereunder, is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor and shall be fined not more than $500, plus court costs for each
offense. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation or non-compliance occurs or continues. The owner of any
building or premises or part thereof where anything is in violation of this
Zoning Code is placed or exists; and any architect, builder, contractor,
individual, or corporation employed in connection therewith who assisted in the
commission of any such violation, is guilty of a separate offense and shall be
fined as herein provided.
(Prior Code, § 154.99) (Ord. 95-3, passed 2-28-1995)
